DataElement.preferredName: Breast Ultrasound Imaging Lymph Node Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the appearance of lymph nodes evaluated by ultrasonography.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Ultrasound Imaging Lymph Node Appearance
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._A technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer._A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
The use of high-frequency sound waves to generate images of the body.

Property.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.:The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.
The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._A technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer._A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Wide in width, extent or cross-section.: The portion of the lymph node that contains nodules with germinal centers where B lymphocyte mature into plasma cells after activation. The nodules are separated by diffuse lymphatic tissue, lymph sinuses and trabeculae.

Concepts.definition: Wide in width, extent or cross-section.

The portion of the lymph node that contains nodules with germinal centers where B lymphocyte mature into plasma cells after activation. The nodules are separated by diffuse lymphatic tissue, lymph sinuses and trabeculae.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Loss; a gradual decline in amount or activity.: The concave side of the lymph node.

Concepts.definition: A gradual decline in amount or activity.
The concave side of the lymph node.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
